english: A dog is a man's friend.
The cat sleeps in the sun.
It's raining, but I have an umbrella.
I love chocolate.
There are books in the library.
The teacher explains a new topic.
My friend plays the guitar.
I am reading an interesting book.
Children play on the playground.
The coffee is hot and aromatic.

slovene: Sonce močno sije na modrem nebu.
english: The sun shines strong in the blue sky.
Birds sing in the morning.
The car is parked in front of the house.
The bicycle rides fast.
Breakfast is an important meal.
Winter brings snow and cold.
The sea is calm and blue.
The pizza is hot and tasty.
The picnic is organized in the park.
Goats graze in the meadow.
Stars shine in the sky.
There are old paintings in the museum.

slovene: S prijatelji smo šli na sprehod.
english: We went for a walk with friends.
The bus leaves at nine.
I train twice a week.
In the store they sell fresh fruit.
Summer is a time for rest.
I visit my grandmother every weekend.
The water in the lake is warm.
Fruit is healthy and tasty.
Books expand the horizons.

slovene: V šoli se učimo nove stvari.
english: We learn new things at school.
The last page of the book is interesting.
My family loves nature.
Breakfast is ready.
The brain needs enough sleep.
Cviček is a Slovenian wine.
Cycling is good exercise.
Dinner is being prepared on the grill.
I watch movies on weekends.
Happiness is in small things.
The fair takes place every year.
We learn Slovenian words.
It's time to rest.
At night I dream of travels.
The sunset is very beautiful.
We play board games with friends.
Roses bloom in spring.
I adore desserts and sweets.
The wind carries the scent of flowers.
We look forward to the upcoming holiday.
Moments with family are precious.

slovene: Brez skrbi, vse bo v redu.
english: Don't worry, everything will be fine.
I enjoy exploring new places.
Morning coffee gives me energy.

slovene: Tudi mali dosežki so bili pomembni.
english: Even small achievements were important.
We understood each other without words.

slovene: Čez vikend sem šel na izlet.
english: I went on a trip over the weekend.

slovene: Sodelovanje je bilo ključno za uspeh.
english: Collaboration was key for success.

slovene: V naravi sem našel notranji mir.
english: In nature, I found inner peace.

slovene: Vsaka nova izkušnja nas je obogatila.
english: Every new experience enriched us.

slovene: Učili smo se iz svojih napak.
english: We learned from our mistakes.

slovene: Moji prijatelji so bili vedno ob meni.
english: My friends were always by my side.

slovene: Uživali smo v prijetnih skupnih trenutkih.
english: We enjoyed pleasant moments together.
Tomorrow I will go for a walk.
I will open a new store.
We will meet soon.
School will start in September.
The world will become better.
The weather will be nice this week.
The weekend will be full of fun.

slovene: Moji starši bodo odpotovali v tujino.
english: My parents will travel abroad.
The students will take exams.
Monday will be a strenous day.

slovene: Novi film bo izšel ta mesec.
english: The new movie will be released this month.
We will watch an interesting show.
My friend will become a doctor.
Tomorrow I will do the homework.
On Sunday I will run the marathon.

slovene: Naslednje leto bom živela v tujini.
english: Next year, I will live abroad.
Dad will buy a new car.

slovene: Teta bo spekla torto za rojstni dan.
english: Aunt will bake a cake for the birthday.

slovene: Otroci bodo igrali nogomet v parku.
english: The kids will play football in the park.
We will laugh carefreely.

slovene: Gorivo se bo naslednji teden podražilo.
english: Fuel will increase in price next week.
We will participate in the sports competition.
I will visit friends in Slovenia.
I will order a new book.
Dinner will be ready at seven.
I will learn a new language.
We will hear interesting stories.
People will come to the concert.
I will assemble a new computer.
We will solve all the problems together.
We will meet new friends.
Last year they went on a trip.
We will continue to learn.
I will enjoy nature.
We will solve all the puzzles.
I will go to the market tomorrow.
I will order a new dress.

slovene: Vse slike bomo obesili na steno.
english: We will hang all the pictures on the wall.
Friends will come for a visit.
We will solve all the problems today.
We will spend our vacation in the mountains.
My son will play football.

slovene: Babica bo imela praznovanje za vse.
english: Grandma will have a celebration for everyone.
I will gift my friends.
We will be happy when we see each other.

slovene: Srečali se bomo ob deseti uri.
english: We will meet at ten o'clock.
Soon we will have a new house.
I will solve all the problems.

slovene: Če bom imel čas, bom prišel.
english: If I have time, I will come.

slovene: Če bi imela denar, bi potovala.
english: If I had money, I would travel.

slovene: Če bi bilo vreme lepo, bi šli ven.
english: If the weather was nice, we would go out.

slovene: Če bi vedel odgovor, bi ti povedal.
english: If I knew the answer, I would tell you.

slovene: Če bi bilo mogoče, bi ostal dlje.
english: If it were possible, I would stay longer.

slovene: Če bi imela izbiro, bi izbrala tebe.
english: If I had a choice, I would choose you.

slovene: Če bi bilo več časa, bi se bolje pripravili.
english: If there were more time, we would prepare better.

slovene: Če bi prišel prej, bi dobil boljši sedež.
english: If you came earlier, you would get a better seat.

slovene: Če bi imela več časa, bi šla na fitnes.
english: If I had more time, I would go to the gym.

slovene: Če bi lahko, bi pomagal vsakomur.
english: If I could, I would help everyone.

slovene: Če bi vedela, bi se pripravila.
english: If I knew, I would have prepared.

slovene: Če bi vedela, da bo deževalo, bi vzela dežnik.
english: If I knew it would rain, I would take an umbrella.

slovene: Če bi imela več denarja, bi kupila hišo.
english: If I had more money, I would buy a house.

slovene: Če bi te videl, bi te pozdravil.
english: If I saw you, I would greet you.

slovene: Če bi bil na tvojem mestu, bi to naredil.
english: If I were in your place, I would do that.

slovene: Če bi se le lahko vrnila nazaj v čas.
english: If I could only go back in time.

slovene: Če bi imela radio, bi poslušala glasbo.
english: If I had a radio, I would listen to music.

slovene: Če bi bil šef, bi izboljšal delovno okolje.
english: If I were the boss, I would improve the work environment.

slovene: Če bi bilo dovolj ljudi, bi organizirali dogodek.
english: If there were enough people, we would organize an event.

slovene: Če bi vedela, bi se raje odločila za drugo možnost.
english: If I knew, I would rather choose another option.

slovene: Če bi šel ven, bi si privoščil pijačo.
english: If I went out, I would treat myself to a drink.

slovene: Če bi mi pokazali pot, bi šel z vami.
english: If you showed me the way, I would go with you.

slovene: Če bi imel priložnost, bi šel na konferenco.
english: If I had the opportunity, I would go to the conference.

slovene: Če bi bil sončen dan, bi šli na plažo.
english: If it were a sunny day, we would go to the beach.
Are you happy today?
When will you come again?
Is this really good?
Why are you so worried?
Where did you lose your phone?
Did you eat a healthy breakfast?

slovene: Ali si kdaj potoval v tujino?
english: Have you ever traveled abroad?
How did you feel yesterday?
Do you have any special plans?

slovene: Kdaj si nazadnje šel na morje?
english: When did you last go to the sea?
Will you be at school tomorrow?

slovene: Ali je ta film res smešen?
english: Is this movie really funny?
How quickly did you finish the task?
Do you have enough time today?
Did you sleep well yesterday?
What will we eat for lunch?

slovene: Ali ti je ta knjiga všeč?
english: Do you like this book?

slovene: Kdo te je povabil na zabavo?
english: Who invited you to the party?

slovene: Ali se boš učil za izpit?
english: Will you study for the exam?

Will the weather be nice tomorrow?

slovene: Kaj si videl na poti domov?
english: What did you see on your way home?

slovene: Kako si izvedel za ta dogodek?
english: How did you find out about this event?

slovene: Ali ti je ta pesem všeč?
english: Do you like this song?

slovene: Kako dolgo že poznaš svojega prijatelja?
english: How long have you known your friend?
When will you visit Ljubljana again?
Have you eaten lunch yet?

slovene: Kdo ti je pomagal pri nalogi?
english: Who helped you with the assignment?
Do you know where the library is?

slovene: Kako si izvedel, da so bili tukaj?
english: How did you find out they were here?
When will we meet again?

slovene: Ali ti je ta kava premočna?
english: Is this coffee too strong for you?

slovene: Ali ti je ta torta všeč?
english: Do you like this cake?

slovene: Kdaj si zadnjič videl to osebo?
english: When did you last see this person?

slovene: Ali si že kdaj jedel suši?
english: Have you ever eaten sushi?
